data.title: Want Variety and great Food?  Come here!
data.text: Great food, fun and service!  The variety here is awesome and unique. Encourage you to visit when you come to Bismarck.

data.title: Excellent Lunch
data.text:
On our way out of Bismarck, we decided we needed something for lunch.  No place in particular in mind when we saw Lucky Duck, and thought this could be fun.  It was!

A very large sandwich selection all themed around various ducks.  Also salads and Mexican simple foods.  We both had grilled sandwiches, which were excellent.

There are two other restaurants on either side that are all interconnected.

data.title: Good lunch spot
data.text: They serve good soup and sandwiches.  For lunch it is much better than the usual alternatives, not greasy and stuffing you with a cheap meal.   Our food tasted fresh and the service was good to us with our young twin boys.  I could see this place being packed during the lunch hour.

data.title: Wow!
data.text: I was told everything was fantastic and that was no exaggeration.   Everyone had something different, and everyone raved about the food.  And the servings are huge.   Completely satisfying.

data.title: Not what I expected-but the service rocks!
data.text: A friend brought me here, raving about their duck tacos.  Well, there is every little duck, sausage, in the tacos.  And for a deli atmosphere, it was on the expensive side.  I had a hard time finding anything I wanted to eat.  However, the staff just could not be nicer or do enough for you.  So friendly and genuine.  The best part of the experience.

data.title: Great food,drinks and love sitting at the rail
data.text:
I had a sandwich and my better half had a salad. Both very good but would be nice to get maybe some chips and such with the sandwich. It looks lonely on the plate by itself. Also had a drink that was constructed very good. 
The best part was being able to sit outside and watch the world go by.

data.title: Sarah Anderson
data.text: This place is great!  Fantastic food, great beer, and a fun relaxing atmosphere.  Perfect for a date night or a family dinner.

data.title: Good food casual seating
data.text: Vegetarian options, good sandwiches, only fountain drinks, very casual seating like a diner. Good for families. Enjoyed the menu titles and sound of live music next door.

data.title: Great atmosphere... Absolutely horrible service!
data.text: This place is always hit or mess with service. There is absolutely no consistency or service standards at this restaurant. We'd love to come to Lucky ducks/the pond because we love the outdoor atmosphere. We always preferred to sit outside on the patio to enjoy the nice summer evenings. The food is also very good but like I said your service is very much lacking. Do not ever sit upstairs as you will be ignored, you will have to wait a long time for your food and a lot of times when the servers actually bring the food upstairs they're not sure which table it should go to, and if you need a quick beer refill plan on waiting for quite a while as the servers have to go downstairs to get your alcoholic beverage. This place could be the number one restaurant/bar in downtown Bismarck but because their service is lacking it's simply cannot be rated number one. I will continue to come back to this restaurant as I know different servers provide different types of experiences! On the lighter side this restaurant has numerous deli sandwiches lots of different types of appetizers and hors d'oeuvres. The only thing I recommend is staying away from the duck wings they seem to be a little tough and not as flavorful as you would assume!

data.title: It is a Crime
data.text:
My favorite appetizer in all of Bismarck is the Taco Dip served at Pond (the adjacent bar connected to and with the Lucky Duck.)  The Taco Dip is huge, so flavorful and always perfect.  It goes perfectly with a cold beer or a Canadian whiskey.

The service at the Pond is also consistent.  It is always horrible.  Last Saturday August 20th we arrived around 4 PM in the afternoon and sat down in the patio.  After 15 minutes a waitress finally recognized us, handed us menus and then told us our server would be right with us.  Three more parties entered the patio.  Each party had ordered and received there first round of drinks before we had been approached by a server.  I finally went up to an employee that appeared competent. I asked if we were sitting at a table that did not receive service.  She apologized, stating that here was a shift change.  She then took our order and became our server.  She provided us with more than adequate service for the rest of our stay.

The problem is that this type of breakdown happens every time we go there.  And we want to go there a lot because I crave the Taco Dip. A friend heard that we were going out for afternoon drinks and cocktails and wanted to join us.  When we told them we were going to the Pond they recanted their invitation.  They stated that the last time they went to the Pond it took 45 minutes for them to put in a drink order.  Last Saturday it was not overwhelmingly busy.  There always seemed to be employees talking at the bar to other employees.  Please put a manager on duty to ensure effective service.  And if a manager was on duty last Saturday then I suggest looking at a different manager.  The server that helped us seems like an option. She was extremely professional once she found us.

The patio at the Pond is a beautiful venue.  Your food is awesome.  It is a crime to  have such a wonderful product and not support it with consistent service.

data.title: 3rd Strike, you're out!
data.text: This was my third time here.  1st time was a year ago with business colleagues, took over an hour for food.  Second time was in June with my wife.  Took over 45 minutes for our food.  Today I should of listened to my wife.  We brought our daughter and ordered salads!  Took 45 minutes to get our food!  We will not be back!

data.title: slow service
data.text: We went here for lunch on a Sunday.  It was mostly empty but filled up as it got later.  The service was really slow.  The foot itself is average at best.  I'd try elsewhere before I'd come back here.

data.title: BIG sandwiches and airy views
data.text: Lucky Duck's is the go to lunch place in downtown Bismarck. Feeling hungry? You'll be challenged to finish a half sandwich and homemade potato chips here. Try The Mallard or Ringneck or just about any other sandwich on their menu and you'll have more than you can eat. Dine in an open air setting, or under cover, either way you're going to be happy, and your stomach will be filled!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Been here many a times and they were having an off day today.  Order was wrong with one person, then I found a bread bag clip in my sandwich and no apology or nothing.  Not sure if I'll head back again.

data.title: I HAD high expectations as The Pond/Lucky Ducks was highly recommended by family
data.text:
My sisters in law love going to this place so we were excited to try it while visiting. Our other friends raved about the food too so I thought it was a great idea to eat here. We came at happy hour so I ordered a glass of wine and chicken wings. The wings were okay but spendy at $10. For my entree, I tried the lobster carbonara and the sauce was a bit thin.  The lobster isn't Maine lobster because it was langostino (which is written on the menu) so the texture was a bit different. While waiting for our appetizers, the waitstaff told us that they will need the entire balcony area for a 7pm booking.  We had time to eat our appetizers and after that they moved us inside which was very noisy. They were very busy on a Friday night. They comped our first round of drinks at least. After my wine, I tried the Cattail Margarita which was STRONG, well it should be at $8 a pop. 

They had an acoustic singer that night and she was really good. 

I'd rethink if I'll go back here next time I'm in town.

data.title: Very dissapointed
data.text: Came  here with friends to celebrate my birthday.  Asked the server Joel what the happy hour specials were, he said "it's happy hour? What time is it? I just got to work. Hello, what time did you have to be at work? Ordered appetizers which Were medium to cold, told the server, he looked surprised said he would take care of it came back with replacement appetizers and they were medium to cold again. Told him again, he said I can get them redone, we were like, you already have had 2 attempts. We then asked for a manager who also looked surprised that the food was medium to cold Needless to say, we don't be eating here again.

data.title: Great apps and music
data.text: A cpl friends and I came to listen to the music on the outdoor patio and enjoyed some drinks and appetizers. Taco dip, chicken bacon artichoke flatbed pizza and calamari.

data.title: Lucky to find a place to sit
data.text: This place is so good to eat on the run or sit down and visit or have drinks with friends.  Have never had problems with wait staff, management is always around making sure things are going as needed, and food never disappoints.  Has a deli area to eat, bar, outdoor seating that sometimes hosts bands, and then there is an upstairs which is where we always try to sit.  Fun place

data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: Go here often with friends or co-workers. It is located on the edge of downtown. Love the Cajun shrimp tacos and burgers! Also good drinks and very nice patio in the back.

data.title: Great Sandwiches
data.text: Great place for lunch, the Sandwich I had put a whole other spin on Sandwich. It had plenty of meat and flavor. The place was busy, and the atmosphere felt like this was the place to be.
